subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Agrilus viridicupreus Saunders, 1866
. Described from inexplicit number of specimens. Type locality: “Laas”. Type specimens: Lectotype ♂ ( BMNH ): “Type SYNTYPE [p] [round label with blue border] \ Laas [h] Mouhot [p] \ Type [p] \ Saunders 74.18 [p] \ viridipurpureus [sic!] ES Type Laas [h]”. Lectotype by Jendek (2007) . Secondary types: 1 PLT ( BMNH ).

Agrilus cylindratus Kerremans, 1896
. Described from inexplicit number of specimens. Type locality: “ Sumatra ”. Type specimens: Lectotype ♂ (BMNH): “ Sumatra , Manuf. Tabacs [h] \ SYNTYPE [p] [round label with blue border] \ cylindratus Kerrem. Type [h] \
Kerremans 1903
-59 [p]”. Lectotype by Jendek (2007) . Secondary types: 1 PLT (BMNH).

Agrilus brooksi
Fisher, 1930
. Described from 1 specimen ( holotype by monotypy). Type locality: “Samawang, near Sandakan, North Borneo ”.
Type specimens:
Holotype ♀ (USNM): “N. BORNEO SAMAWANG NR. SAN- DAKAN [p] jungle 14th [h] July, 1927 [p]; [underside] C. B. K[loss]. & H. M. P[endlebury]. [leg.] F. M. S. Museums. [p] [pink label] \ TypeNo [p] 57432 [h] USNM [p] [red label] \ Agrilus brooksi Fisher [p]”.

Agrilus albizziae
Fisher, 1935
. Described from 8 specimens ( Holotype & paratypes ). Type locality: “Mid Java : Semarang”. Type specimens: Holotype ♂ (USNM): “ L. G. E. Kalshoven Java Semarang Teaj Forest [p] 30. 3. [h] 19 [p] 31 [h] No [p] K7a! [h] \ TypeNo [p] 57376 [h] Holotype [p] [red ink] Agrilus albizziae Fisher [h] [white label with red border]”.

Agrilus javicola Fisher, 1935
. Described from 3 specimens ( Holotype & paratypes ). Type locality: “Mid Java : Telawa (Semarang Residency)”. Also cited from Indonesia : East Java . Type specimens: Holotype ♀ (USNM): “ Java [p] K 54 [h] M. [p] Telawa Ged. XII-31 [h] L. G. E. Kalshoven [p] \ TypeNo [p] 57374 [h] USNM [red label] \ Holotype [p] [red ink] Agrilus javicola Fisher [white label with red border]”. Paratypes : 1 (USNM).

Agrilus cariosulus Obenberger, 1935
. Described from inexplicit number of specimens.
Type locality:
“ Java : Salak. 1920 m ”.
Type specimens
. 1 ST (NMPC).

Agrilus kelnerae
Descarpentries & Villiers, 1963
. Described from 1 specimen ( Holotype ). Type locality: “Tonkin: Hoa Binh ”. Type specimens: Holotype ♀ (MNHN): “ TONKIN REGION DE HOA BINH [p] \ ♂ [sic!] TYPE [p] [red label] \ Agrilus Kelnerae n. sp. Holotype ♂ [sic!] nob[is]. A. Descarpentries et [h] A. Villiers det. 19 [p] 63 [h]”.

Agrilus theodasae
Baudon, 1968
. Described from 1 specimen ( holotype ). Type locality: “ Laos : Vientiane ”.
Type specimens:
Holotype ♂ (MHNB): “ Vientiane x.[19]62 [h] Laos (Baudon) [p] \ Type [p] [red label] \ Agrilus theodasae mihi Type [h] A. Baudon det. [p] [blue label]”.
Remark . Despite
the fact that just a single holotype is declared in the description, some specimens in collections are improperly labeled as paratypes : 1 (HHCC) 3 (MHNB), 1 (USNM).

Examined specimens.
MYANMAR .
Mandalay .
Taunggyi ; 21°20’N , 095°59’E ; 9-1952
;
2 ♂ , 7 ♀ ( EJCB )
.

Shan. near Hsipaw; 22°37’27”N , 097°15’35”E ; 7-20006; alt. 500 m ; 1 ♂ ( EJCB )
\\ Nyaung Shwe S /E; 20°39‘34”N , 096°57’53”E ; 11-2003; alt.
920 m
; 1 ♂ , 1 ♀ ( EJCB )
\\ VIETNAM .
Dong Nai .
120 km NNE Ho Chi Minh , env. Cat Tien vill.; 11°24’55”N , 107°23’59”E ; 6-1995; 1 ♂ ( MKCY )
\\ Nam Cat Tien Nat. Park ; 11°27‘N , 107°19‘E ; 5-1994; 1 ♂ ( EJCB )
.
Distribution. INDONESIA : Java , Sumatra ; LAOS : Khammouan , Vientiane prefecture ; MALAYSIA : Sabah ; MYANMAR : Mandalay , Shan ; VIETNAM : Dong Nai , Hoa Binh , Ninh Binh .

Host plant. Larval:
Albizia
and
Buchanania florida Schauer
(cited by Fisher 1935 for
A. albizziae
);
Acacia gageana Craib
and
Albizia lebbek
(L.) Benth. (cited by Beeson 1941 for
A. albizziae
). Adult:
Acacia tomentosa Willd.
(cited by Fisher 1935 for
A. javicola
). Very likely also larval host. The record cited by Kerremens (1896) “dans les tabacs” as
A. cylindratus
is not plausible.

Remarks. The synonymy of
A. viridicupreus
is tentative because some primary types are females and because of a deficiency of study material mostly from the insular Indonesia . The aedeagus of male primary types of
A. viridicupreus
( Laos ),
A. cylindratus
(Java),
A. albizziae
(Java) and
A. theodasae
( Laos ) are all of the same type ( Fig. 4A ) which, together with examined conspecific specimens from Myanmar and Vietnam , indicates that
A. viridicupreus
range expands from Myanmar to Indonesian Java. The female primary types of
A. brooksi (Borneo)
,
A. javicola
(Java),
A. cariosulus
(Java) and
A. kelnerae
( Vietnam ) are tentatively treated as conspecific with
A. viridicupreus
until proven otherwise. The reason is the lack of diagnostic characters of female specimen which prevents conclusive identification. For the ultimate resolution of this problem, additional material, employment of molecular techniques and/or fixation of neotypes is needed. See also Remarks under
A. babaulti .
